conclusion: Need to calculate the area under the velocity-time graph for the interval to determine the distance fallen.
The interval of interest is from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s. At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is approximately 10 m/s. The graph appears linear between these points.
The area under the graph between t = 10 seconds and t = 15 seconds can be calculated as the area of a trapezoid.
Formula for the area of a trapezoid: Area = 1/2 × (Base1 + Base2) × Height
Substitute the values: Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, Height = 5 seconds into the trapezoid area formula.
The calculated area under the v-t graph for the interval is exactly 75 meters.
